pageContext.claim: “We then made the ship COVID, because, you know, there weren't a lot of people on the roads; you didn't have the accidents that we thought -- other unrelated accidents. There's nobody driving. You know, normally you have a lot of car accidents. You have a lot of motorcycle accidents. You have people going to the hos- -- we didn't have that. We had almost none of it. ”
pageContext.analysis: New Yorkers are in fact still driving recklessly. Data show that the number of speeding tickets for a week in late March was comparable to a week in January.
